title: Is the Intel i3 10th generation better than the Intel i5 6th generation for better performance and multitasking (laptop)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends what models you’re referring to. There are numerous i3-10th gen stuff for laptops. There’s also numerous i5-6th gen as well. These tend to vary even more between those models. As sample, 3 of the “10th” gen i3’s compared to one of the “6th” gen i5s: Intel Core i3-10100T @ 3.00GHz vs Intel Core i5-6440HQ @ 2.60GHz vs Intel Core i3-1005G1 @ 1.20GHz vs Intel Core i3-10110U @ 2.10GHz One of them is in fact faster, both single and multi thread. While the other two are a bit below the multi thread and slightly higher on single thread. Not enormously, but still. E.g. for single thread between the i5–6440HQ and the i3–10110U there’s a 14% improvement. But then that i3 is only 78% as fast as the i5 on multi threads, a drop of 22%. Then again, the newest i3–10100T beats that i5 in multi threads by a whopping 43%. Probably due in part to it now having 4 cores hyper threaded to try and compete with the AMD Ryzens. Previously the i5 only had 4 cores and no hyperthreading. But then its single thread performance isn’t a hugely faster thing, in fact it’s ever so slightly slower than the i3–10110U’s single threads by fractions of a %.

In gaming performance, not all i3 is better than i5 processor of two different gen. That means i5 of 6th gen with H - series processor outperforms the i3 of 10th gen u series processor actually. And for the multi-tasking aspect then i5 processor will clearly win the aspect at no time. As i5 has more cores’ and threads’ than the i3 10th processor or any new-gen has yet in it. So, you can stream by using the i5 processor. In the end, not in all ASPECT DO AN I3 PROCESSOR WILL WIN OVER THE I5 PROCESSOR EVEN IF THE TWO PROCESSOR ARE OF DIFFERENT GEN OF INTEL COMPANY. Have a nice day.
